page.title: 09Shorko Films,Swindon
page.content: Shorko Films make{packaging}for many different food products.They have been open for 21 years and are still expanding.They start off with polypropylene which looks like small white balls of polystyrene.They melt it and flatten it to make sure there are no air bubbles in it. Then it is melted and stretched.It is rolled up onto big rolls.The biggest rolls are 19000 metres long .These are sent to other factories called converters. There they are cut up and printed into{food wrappers}like these:- Penguins,Maltesers,Sunny Fruit Malt,Walkers crisps,Double Decker, Scampi Fries and K.P.nuts and raisins. 302 people work at the factory.They do not have their own lorries.They hire the lorries. This is the only factory they have in Britain. There are other factories in Paris and Australia.
